page.title: 05The Church, Milton Ernest
page.content: {All Saint's Church}is of{Church of {England}denomination dating from the 12th century. It has a mediaeval rood screen, a stained glass window and painted roof designed by{William {Butterfield,}a 17th century brass chandelier, double clerestory windows, a 500 year old font of Bedfordshire clunch and bread shelves donated by Susanna Rolt; a charitble provision in perpetuity. Above the porch was a parvise. There is an organ and a peal of six bells. Morning and evening services are held every Sunday, Monday and Wednesday for a congregation of about 30. Affiliated Church clubs are: Bellringers, Pathfinders, CYFA and Sunday School. There is a new vicarage built in 1967 replacing the Victorian vicarage which became a Craft Centre and is now a private home. The Church is linked closely with the School.
